00064 void Text::addCharacter (const char &character, const unsigned int &position)
00065 {
00066     if(position > content_.length())
00067         content_.append(1, character);
00068     else
00069     {
00070         if (position < 0)
00071             content_.insert(0, 1, character);
00072         else
00073             content_.insert(position, 1, character);
00074     }
00075     
00076     // Rebuild the appearance rate of every word in text
00077     computeWordRates();
00078 };

00080 
00089 void Text::addCharacter (const char &character)
00090 {
00091     // Call the generic 'addCharacter' function
00092     addCharacter(character, content_.length());
00093 }

00105 void Text::removeCharacter (const unsigned int &position)
00106 {
00107     if (position > content_.length())
00108         content_.erase(content_.end());
00109     else
00110     {
00111         if ( position < 0 )
00112             content_.erase(content_.begin());
00113         else
00114             content_.erase(position, 1);
00115     }
00116     
00117     // Rebuild the appearance rate of every word in text
00118     computeWordRates();
00119 };

00141 void Text::content (const std::string &content)
00142 {

00145     // Rebuild the appearance rate of every word in the new text
00146     computeWordRates();
00147 };

00182 void Text::updateWordRate (const std::string &word)
00183 {
00184     // Searches the word in the vector
00185     std::vector<WordRate>::iterator wordRates;
00186     for (wordRates = wordRates_.begin(); wordRates not_eq wordRates_.end(); ++wordRates)
00187     {
00188         // Updates its appearance rate
00189         if ( (*wordRates).first == word )
00190         {
00191             (*wordRates).second++;
00192             return;
00193         }
00194     }
00195     
00196     // The word was not stored, so here we adds its first appearance
00197     wordRates_.push_back(WordRate(word, 1));
00198 };
00199 
00200 
00208 void Text::computeWordRates ()
00209 {
00210     std::vector<std::string> words; // Vector to hold our words after removing spaces
00211     
00212     // Extract the words in text
00213     tokenize(words);
00214     
00215     // Update appearance rate of every word extracted
00216     std::vector<std::string>::iterator wordsIterator;
00217     for (wordsIterator = words.begin(); wordsIterator not_eq words.end(); ++wordsIterator)
00218         updateWordRate(*wordsIterator);
00219         
00220     // This sorting will improve future lookups
00221     std::sort (wordRates_.begin(), wordRates_.end());
00222 };
00223 
00224 
00232 void Text::tokenize(std::vector<std::string>& tokens, const std::string& delimiters) const
00233 {
00234     // Skip delimiters at the beginning of text
00235     std::string::size_type lastPos = content_.find_first_not_of(delimiters, 0);
00236     
00237     // Find the first "non-delimiter"
00238     std::string::size_type pos     = content_.find_first_of(delimiters, lastPos);
00239     
00240     // Traverse the content until reaching its end
00241     while ( (std::string::npos not_eq pos) or (std::string::npos not_eq lastPos) )
00242     {
00243         // A word has been found, add it to the vector
00244         tokens.push_back(content_.substr(lastPos, pos - lastPos));
00245         
00246         // Skip delimiters again
00247         lastPos = content_.find_first_not_of(delimiters, pos);
00248         
00249         // Find the next "non-delimiter"
00250         pos = content_.find_first_of(delimiters, lastPos);
00251     }
00252 };
